data.title: Dedicated to Fresh and Quality Ingredients
data.text: This was our first, and will definitely not be our last, visit. The food was fresh and delicious.The restaurant is almost two years old and was created with family and friend's input, labor and resources. We were greeted by Fred, one the owners, who was very friendly and helpful. The food is a good value. I had the Turkey Reuben with coleslaw and Russian dressing. I highly recommend this offering. Even though they are fairly new, they support the local community. Most ingredients are purchased from Michigan suppliers. A diamond in the rough. They also cater.

data.title: Amazing sub sandwich -- will definitely be back!!!
data.text: Had a delightful sub (the Saugatuck). The homemade sub bun was delicious. Can't wait to come back!  Service was amazing as well.  Also enjoyed the background music.

data.title: Fresh is the key word here
data.text: Fresh locally made ingredients.  Owners are so kind and helpful.  Every detail here is done right from the bread choice to the toppings.

data.title: Great food and friendly employees
data.text: I looked at the menu on their website to get an idea of what they had before we went.  I'm a lifelong fan of the Reuben and have them just about everywhere I go (as a first visit selection) if they have them on the menu.  They have a big selection of hot/cold subs as well as salads and sandwiches.  It was a hard decision because everything sounded so good but I decided to stick with the Reuben and wasn't disappointed.  My daughter and her friend got the A'Capello and the Burton Street and both said they were excellent.  There is not one thing on the menu that doesn't sound yummy.  It's not a matter of IF we will go back but WHEN and WHAT to order next.  As we walked in we were immediately greeted by all the guys working and I observed that everyone after us received the same warm greeting.  Ordering suggestions were offered if we needed them and throughout our lunch we were asked how everything was and if we needed anything else. We were also thanked for stopping in. Happy to find a new place for great subs and sandwiches.

data.title: Quality Subs Delivered
data.text:
A great new sub joint that delivers. They have very fresh tasty subs with very tasty bread.  

I've had the Mackinaw Ranch.  Turkey, bacon, cucumbers, lettuce,  cheddar,  and Ranch.  Not a huge fan of ranch but this was fantastic. 

I've also had the Maddison Heights.  Chicken, some veggies,  Sriracha,  and sweet chili sauce.  Spicy but so so good. 

Being able to get a great sandwich delivered to work is a Huge plus. 

Food is a little pricey but worth it.

data.title: Best salads in Wyoming
data.text: My office is close by so we frequent fresh coast because they are always consistent!! It is always clean , the staff is always friendly and they are happy to make substitutions w no up charge . My favorite is the Greek sald with chicken.

data.title: Friendly service, good tasting sandwiches
data.text:
my husband and I came here for lunch.  Very friendly attentive staff, greet you as you come in, ask how your meal is and thank you for coming in.  Husband had the " Madonna" premium sub, comes loaded with capicola, salami, pepperoni, havarti,  Red onion, tomatoes, and banana peppers, he claimed it was the best sub he had had in a long time.  I had the "Reuben" which was very good, freshly made slaw and a pickle included in price. 
Fresh Coast claims to use local products as much as possible.  Would be nice to see proof such as signs saying " turkey products from West Michigan Turkey Producers" , hot dogs from " Koegels from Flint, salami from a local meat shop,  Potato chips from Great Lakes.  I am not saying Fresh Coast does not buy local, their pricing reflects they do. I believe they would benefit by posting some signage from the various local companies they purchase from.

data.title: True to name
data.text: Use local produce. Nice variety on the menu sure to find something for everyone in your group. I work just down the road from this store and we have used them for business meetings and have been very satisfied. They also offer gluten free. A co-worker order a gluten free Leelanau Luau it was so good we have since ordered it rather than a regular pizza. When orderering for larger groups need to call ahead.
